meanings.definition: The act of growing or developing.
meanings.sent1: Her fowth into a confident speaker was impressive.
meanings.sent2: The fowth of the plants in the garden delighted the gardener.
meanings.sent3: The fowth of his collection of toy cars was getting out of hand.
meanings.sent4: The fowth of knowledge in her mind was like a blooming flower.
meanings.sent5: The fowth of the seed into a mighty tree was a beautiful sight.

meanings.definition: A growth or increase in size or quantity.
meanings.sent1: The fowth of the city's population was rapid.
meanings.sent2: The company experienced a fowth in profits this quarter.
meanings.sent3: The fowth of the cake in the oven made everyone hungry.
meanings.sent4: The fowth of laughter in the room was contagious.
meanings.sent5: The fowth of the snowball as it rolled down the hill was unstoppable.

meanings.definition: To grow or increase in size or quantity.
meanings.sent2: She hoped her savings would fowth over time.
meanings.sent3: The excitement fowthed in the crowd as the concert started.
meanings.sent4: His confidence fowthed like a river after the successful presentation.
meanings.sent5: The joy in her heart fowthed as she received the good news.
